definition: to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Romance is seeing flowers withering away you want to cry.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是瞧见花将凋零想哭泣。

sentences.english: Then Argus appeared and saw them.
sentences.chinese: 这时阿格斯突然出现，瞧见了他们。

sentences.english: The head of an enormous dog was outlined in the darkness at the entrance of the hut.
sentences.chinese: 黑暗中瞧见在那茅棚的洞口显出一只大狗头。

sentences.english: You should have seen her smile when she saw me wearing a hat.
sentences.chinese: 你得看看她瞧见我戴帽子时的开心笑脸。

sentences.english: I look at it in the markets and walk away.
sentences.chinese: 我在市场里瞧见它，然后只能默默地走开。

sentences.english: Owls are the only birds that can see the colour blue.
sentences.chinese: 猫头鹰是独一能瞧见蓝色的鸟类。

sentences.english: Cousin saw a group of couples in cloaks soak their souls in the soapy soup.
sentences.chinese: 表哥瞧见一群穿着大氅的匹俦正在胰子汤里浸泡灵魂。

sentences.english: As he walked along, he saw a tax collector sitting in his office. This was Levi, the son of Alpheus .
sentences.chinese: 路上，他瞧见阿耳斐的儿子肋未正坐在税关亭里。

sentences.english: Love me, hate me, but can't you see what I see.
sentences.chinese: 爱上我，忌恨我，但你无法瞧见我所眼见的。

sentences.english: An hour later he sighted the first shark.
sentences.chinese: 一个小时以后，他瞧见了第一条鲨鱼。

sentences.english: On the wedding Isaw blooms embeded in the bed of the bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 在婚礼上，我瞧见卧室的床上镶嵌着花朵。

definition: to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to take a furtive look at
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to cast sidelong glances at sb
